member.param: The ID of the title for the game server.
The ID of service configuration settings. This ID can come from a match ticket.

A unique ticket ID for the request, which should be the same for all members of the group. The string furnished for this ID can contain only alphanumeric characters, hyphens (-), and underscores (_), and can have a maximum of 256 characters.
The GSI set ID to use for the request. This ID comes from a call to the GameServerPlatformService.GetGameServerMetadataAsync Method (UInt32, UInt32, Boolean, UInt32, String).
The ID of the game variant to use for the allocation. This ID comes from a call to GetGameServerMetadataAsync.
The maximum number of players allowed by the game variant.
An identifier for the datacenter to use for allocation. This information originates with QoS probes.
True to abort allocation if the operation is queued, and false otherwise.

member.summary: The measuring initialization stage for QoS measurement is active. If the title is manually managing QoS, then it manages the measuring stage. Otherwise the Xbox system performs this stage.

member.name: F:Evaluating
member.summary: The evaluating initialization stage is active. If the MultiplayerManagedInitialization.AutoEvaluate Property is set to true, then this stage is skipped. Otherwise, the title performs its own evaluation.

member.name: F:Failed
member.summary: The initialization failed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.MultiplayerSessionStatus
member.summary: Current status values for a session.

member.name: F:Unknown
member.summary: The server returned an unrecognized response.

member.name: F:Active
member.summary: The session is active and has at least one member.

member.name: F:Inactive
member.summary: The session is inactive, indicating that no members are active or that all members have left the session.

member.name: F:Pending
member.summary: Deprecated; use Reserved.

member.name: F:Reserved
member.summary: The session is reserved because one or more users have not accepted the session invitation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.MultiplayerPeerToPeerRequirements
member.summary: Represents requirements for a connection between session members.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.MultiplayerSessionJoinRestriction
member.summary: Restrictions on the users who can join a session.

member.name: F:Unknown
member.summary: There was an unrecognized join restriction. This value should never be used because it causes an exception to be thrown.

member.name: F:None
member.summary: Anyone is allowed to join the session. This value cannot be used.

member.name: F:Local
member.summary: Only the following users can join the session: Members of the session Users that have been invited to the session Users that are signed in to the same console as a someone already in the session

member.name: F:Followed
member.summary: Only users who are followed by other session members (as well as the users specified in the Local restriction) can join the session without a reservation. This restriction corresponds to the friends-only party setting.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.MultiplayerPeerToPeerRequirements.BandwidthMinimumInKilobitsPerSecond
member.summary: The minimum bandwidth for the peer-to-peer connection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.MultiplayerSessionReadRestriction
member.summary: Restrictions on the users who can read a session.

member.name: F:Unknown
member.summary: There was an unrecognized read restriction. This value should never be used because it causes an exception to be thrown.

member.name: F:None
member.summary: Anyone is allowed to read the session. This value cannot be used.

member.name: F:Local
member.summary: Only the following users can read the session: Members of the session Users that have been invited to the session Users that are signed in to the same console as a someone already in the session

member.name: F:Followed
member.summary: Only users who are followed by other session members (as well as the users specified in the Local restriction) can read the session without a reservation. This restriction corresponds to the friends-only party setting.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.MultiplayerSessionVisibility
member.summary: Status values for visibility or accessibility of a session.

member.name: F:Unknown
member.summary: The server returned an unrecognized response.

member.name: F:Any
member.summary: Ignore this filter.

member.name: F:Private
member.summary: The session is private and is not visible to users who are not session members. An attempt to join causes the server to return HTTP_E_STATUS_FORBIDDEN.

member.name: F:Visible
member.summary: The session is visible to users who are not in the session, but it is read-only to them and they cannot join. An attempt to join causes the server to return HTTP_E_STATUS_FORBIDDEN.

member.name: F:Full
member.summary: The session is full and cannot be joined by anyone. An attempt to join causes the server to return HTTP_E_STATUS_BAD_REQUEST.

member.name: F:Open
member.summary: The session is open for joining by anyone.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.MultiplayerQualityOfServiceMeasurements
member.summary: Represents matchmaking quality of service (QoS) measurements for the network used by a session member.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.MultiplayerSessionWriteMode
member.summary: Modes used in calls to the MultiplayerService.WriteSessionAsync Method and the MultiplayerService.WriteSessionByHandleAsync Method. For information about error codes associated with the modes, see Return Codes for Xbox One Live Services APIs.

member.name: F:CreateNew
member.summary: Create a session. A call to the write method fails with HTTP_E_STATUS_PRECOND_FAILED if the session already exists.

member.name: F:UpdateOrCreateNew
member.summary: Update or create a session. Since this mode has no preconditions, the call to the write method cannot fail with HTTP_E_STATUS_PRECOND_FAILED.

member.name: F:UpdateExisting
member.summary: Update an existing session. The call to the write method fails with HTTP_E_STATUS_PRECOND_FAILED if the session does not exist.

member.name: F:SynchronizedUpdate
member.summary: Update an existing session to resolve any conflict between two consoles trying to perform an operation at the same time. A call to the write method fails with HTTP_E_STATUS_PRECOND_FAILED if the value of the MultiplayerSession.ETag Property for the local session does not match the value of the TitleStorageBlobMetadata.ETag Property on the server. The call also fails with this error code if the session does not exist.

The ID of the custom invite string that is displayed with the invite notification. The ID must match the ID that is assigned to the custom invite string in the title's multiplayer service configuration. The format of the parameter is "///{id}", where {id} is replaced with the ID of the custom string. For example, if the ID of the custom string "Play Capture the Flag" is 1, then you would set this parameter to "///1" in order to display the "Play Capture the Flag" custom string in the game invite.
The custom activation context.

Gets presence information for multiple users with filters.
member.param: A collection of Xbox user IDs for the target users.

A collection of enumeration values indicating device types, for example, Web or Windows8. The title uses this parameter only to retrieve presence data for users on the device types. The title should leave this parameter empty (default) to retrieve users with all possible device types.

A collection of title IDs. The title uses this parameter only to retrieve presence for users of the title. The title should leave this parameter empty (default) to retrieve data for all possible titles.
An enumeration value indicating the presence detail level. The default enumeration value is All, to retrieve all details.

True if the batch operation filters out records for users that are offline, including cloaked users. This value is false to not filter out records for offline users. If a value is not supplied for this parameter, GetPresenceForMultipleUsersAsync retrieves presence information for both online and offline users.

True if the batch operation filters out records for users that are not broadcasting, and false otherwise. If a value is not supplied for this parameter, GetPresenceForMultipleUsersAsync retrieves presence information for both broadcasting and non-broadcasting users.

A collection of title IDs. The title uses this parameter only to retrieve presence for users of the title. The title should leave this parameter empty (default) to retrieve data for all possible titles.
An enumeration value indicating the presence detail level. The default enumeration value is All, to retrieve all details.

True if the batch operation filters out records for users that are offline, including cloaked users. This value is false to not filter out records for offline users. member.summary: Uploads a blob to title storage.

The buffer containing the blob data.
The ETag match condition used to determine if the blob data should be uploaded.

The preferred upload block size in bytes for binary blobs. The uploader sends binary blobs in blocks of of this size. Use sizes between 1KB and 4MB. Specifying a value outside of this range will cause the default of 256KB to be used. Larger blocks are more efficient, but may result in timeouts.
